title: The Massacre
dialogue_triumphs: This city shall weep tears of blood.

And now they've all gone… None of them could understand, not even my little Susan, or Vicki. And as for Barbara, and Chatterton… Chesterton… they were all too impatient to get back to their own time. Perhaps, I should go home, back to my own planet. But I can't…
goofs: If Dodo is related to Anne Chaplet, why is her name still Chaplet?
Anne's Cornish accent is an odd way to communicate working-class French.

continuity_notes.name: Dodo Chaplet
continuity_notes.description: Full name Dorothea Chaplet, has no living parents and is looked after by an uncaring great aunt. Has a French grandad.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, knowledgeable about history and scientific advancements
continuity_notes.current_status: Reflects on past companions and considers returning home

continuity_notes.name: Anne Chaplet

continuity_notes.current_status: Abandoned by the Doctor, likely killed in the massacre

additional_notes: The Doctor's abandonment of Anne seems almost a reaction to the loss of Katarina, as if he's been taught a lesson about interfering. Hartnell's performance as the Abbot is noted as solid and sinister, showing a different side to his acting abilities.
bottom_line: Not only the best historical, but the best Hartnell, and, in its serious handling of dramatic material in a truly dramatic style, arguably the best ever Doctor Who story.
